exercise.p: Draw a diagram to represent the product \frac{1}{4} \cdot \frac{3}{2}.
Draw a diagram to represent the product \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{3}{4}.
Draw a diagram to represent the product \frac{3}{4} \cdot \frac{3}{4}.

aside.p: Can you explain why 5x = \frac{5x}{1}? Can you think of another way of understanding this calculation?
Keep the terms in the parentheses together. Do not use the distributive property to expand those terms.
Factor the numerator and the denominator.
